title: Nethermind Beam Sync with Teku causes Teku to Error/Exit eventually
body:
<!-- Have you done the following? -->
<!--   * read the Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to -->  
<!--     comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: -->
<!--     https://github.com/PegasysEng/teku/blob/master/CODE-OF-CONDUCT.md -->
<!--   * Reproduced the issue in the latest version of the software -->
<!--   * Read the debugging wiki: https://github.com/PegasysEng/teku/wiki/debugging -->
<!--   * Duplicate Issue check:  https://github.com/search?q=+is%3Aissue+repo%3APegasysEng/Teku -->
<!-- Note:  Not all sections will apply to all issue types. -->

### Description
Running Nethermind with Teku

### Acceptance Criteria
Works without error

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. ./Nethermind.Runner  --config goerli_beam
2. taskset -c 3,4,5,6,7,8 ./teku -c ../../config.yml\

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
Works

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
Initially Teku works fine. Attesting and proposing.

2 failure modes:
A) If Nethermind was just started and hasn't finished initial beam sync 
(restarting Teku after Nethermind is in sync fixes problem short term)

B) Some point further down the line
(Restarting Teku after this does NOT fix problem, have to delete Nethermind DB and restart Nethermind)

Once Teku hits this error it will EXIT!!
(Should not exit but retry!)
Separate logs from failure modes A) and B) shown below.



**Logs from A) Teku started before Nethermind is done with initial beam sync:**

I've been syncing with teku and nethermind on goerli_beam config, and it seems ok, are you still having issues?

I've added some preconditions into the area that saw the problem, and if it does happen again we should get a better message about what shouldn't have been null according to our expectations.

If this is seen again, we should be able to put a specific fix in for this scenario, but at the moment these checks are pretty much all we can do.

I'll close this for now, please feel free to raise another ticket if this happens again, the new log will be very helpful.

I've actually been able to reproduce this just today, and its weird, because even once i fix the head block missing, we go on to try to calculate genesis and look for other blocks, and they come back missing too...

I think the only recommendation I can make is not use `goerli_beam`, as it's missing blocks that it says it has, and we actually need the content of those blocks to be able to operate.

Using `goerli` and pyrmont, I've been running for a while without any issues, i'm up to about slot 14000 on pyrmont and not getting any null blocks back from nethermind as far as I can tell...

This is relevant to Eth2 from Nethermind about fixing an issue with fast sync and transaction receipts: https://medium.com/nethermind-eth/an-important-announcement-from-the-nethermind-team-c31ce785b7f1

Beam sync is not mentioned.
